Sgurr Fhuar-thuill

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Sgurr Fhuar-thuill is a slender, grassy ridge with some dramatic corries. To the northeast is Fhuar-thuill Mor with a fine lochan, whilst to the south is Loch Toll a'Mhuic nestled beneath the slabby crags of Sgurr na Muice, an outlying summit of the mountain.

 You have not climbed Sgurr Fhuar-thuill.

Region: Loch Ness

Altitude: 1049 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.20/5
Rating: 3.2/5 (40 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Circuit of the Strathfarrar Munros

Other routes and challenges

Despite the access restrictions on the route as described from Glen Strathfarrar, the remoteness of the upper reaches of Glen Orrin is enough to discourage most walkers from attemping any ascent from the north - though stalkers' paths from Strathconon may help.
